entry.title: CocoaHeads February 2010 Meeting Agenda
entry.content:
Next CocoaHeads meeting is Thursday, February 11th at Indy Hall.

iPhone SDK 3.2 with support for the new iPad was just announced this month, so we'll definitely have a lot to talk about!

Agenda

  • Meet & Greet - Communicate with other humans using the high bandwidth "face-to-face" protocol.
  • General News
    • Website updates
  • Show & Tell
    • Corey Floyd will demo the prototype of our Philly Beer Week app
  • Minitalks
    • iPhone 3.2/iPad topics

entry.title: CocoaHeads January 2010 Meeting Agenda
entry.content:
Next CocoaHeads meeting is Thursday, January 14th at Indy Hall.

We're getting 2010 off to a great start with a couple great minitalks. The schedule is still open for Show & Tell or hacking on some code.

See you then!

Agenda

  • Meet & Greet - Communicate with other humans using the high bandwidth "face-to-face" protocol.
  • General News
  • Show & Tell
    • Andy Mroczkowski will demo a little open-source control
  • Minitalks
    • Corey Floyd will talk a little bit about NSFetchedResultsController
    • Andy Mroczkowski will share some of his experiences dabbling in the Objective-C Runtime

entry.title: PhillyCocoa.org Hosting
entry.content: The source and content for phillycocoa.org are now hosted on GitHub, using the GitHub Pages feature. Static HTML content is generated using nanoc version 2.2.2, though we are considering migrating to Jekyll. The site's design was intentionally primitive, but if you'd like to see a facelift, patches are welcome.

entry.title: PhillyCocoa 2009 Year-End Wrap-Up
entry.content:
We had a great meeting/year-end wrap-up last Thursday, thanks to everyone who participated. Here are some of the highlights:

Meeting format

The first item of discussion was the format of the CocoaHeads meetings themselves. We'd love to organize in-depth, hour long "tech talks", but that just isn't feasible with our small group and busy schedules. A couple suggestions were:

"Lightning" talks.

In order to accommodate the nature of our group, we're going to try to do Smaller, more focused, "lightning" talks.

Some ideas were:

  • Objective-C runtime
  • Core Data Tips & Tricks
  • Using the NSFetchedResultsController
  • Core Animations HOWTOs
  • Using the Objective Resource library
  • How to do X with Y, etc.

Guest speakers.

Another idea was to have guest speakers or joint meetings either in meatspace or via Skype. The details still need to be worked out, but it's a cool idea if we can make it work.

Challenges.

Finally, we talked about having a focused "challenge" at the end of PhillyCocoa meetings. These could be related to talks, or be just be stand-alone. There is still a lot to be worked out on this one, but it could be a good way to increase collaboration at meetings.

"Hack" nights

There is a lot of interest in hack or "NSCoder" nights. However, we haven't quite found the right recipe for a really great event. Hive 76 has worked well for those of us in the city, but it's not very convenient for out-of-towners. We'd like to continue semi-regular coding nights at Hive 76, but are certainly open to other venues. If you have a suggestion for a venue or would like to organize a coding night, please let us know.

Fund-raising

PhillyCocoa has very low operating costs, but some funds to cover venue costs and provide refreshments for meetings would certainly be nice. There are a few ways to raise a little money:

  • More workshops and classes. These have been very well received so far, but also require a lot of work to run. Still, we'd like to continue them if it all possible since they provide one of the biggest opportunities to raise money for the organization.
  • Sponsors. We're very open to the idea of sponsorship. If you would like to sponsor PhillyCocoa for a perspective sponsor, or would like to sponsor PhillyCocoa, or have a suggestion for a good perspective sponsor, please let us know.
  • Member donations. We don't want to require any sort of dues for PhillyCocoa, but if there are members that would like to donate to the organization of their own free will, we should provide an avenue to do so.

2010

Thanks for being with us in 2009, and we look forward to an even better 2010. If you have any additional thoughts, please hop on the mailing list and share your ideas.

entry.title: CocoaHeads Decemeber 2009 Meeting Agenda
entry.content:
Next CocoaHeads meeting is Thursday, December 10th at Indy Hall.

We don't have any scheduled talks this month. Instead we'll do a year in review, as well as discussing what we'd like to do the following year. Come with thoughts and ideas, or just come to hang out. They'll likely be food and beers involved.

Agenda

  • Meet & Greet - Communicate with other humans using the high bandwidth "face-to-face" protocol.
  • General News
  • Social Hour
